thread.title: Old Lyme's Desautels to be inducted into state girls' soccer Hall of Fame
thread.title_full: Old Lyme's Desautels to be inducted into state girls' soccer Hall of Fame

author: Day Staff Reports
title: Old Lyme's Desautels to be inducted into state girls' soccer Hall of Fame
text:
Old Lyme's Desautels to be inducted into state girls' soccer Hall of Fame Published October 22. 2015 6:29PM Day Staff Reports 
Don Desautels, who coached the Old Lyme High School girls' soccer team from 1991-2009, will be inducted into the Connecticut Girls' Soccer Coaches Association Hall of Fame on Friday, Jan. 29, 2016, at the Aqua Turf Club in Southington. 
Desautels finished with a career record of 242-76-38, guiding the Wildcats to seven Shoreline Conference championships and the 2009 Class S state championship in his final season. He was named The Day's All-Area Coach of the Year five times and was honored with various coaching awards by the New Haven Register and Connecticut High School Coaches Association. 
Desautels, who retired from teaching in 2013, was also a finalist for National Coach of the Year in 2007 by the National High School Coaches Association.
